sentence.Network_en: The government had to overcome isolationist opposition to the plan.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府必须要克服孤立主义者对该计划的反对。

sentence.Network_en: They even set up their own news agency to peddle anti-isolationist propaganda.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们甚至设立了自己的通讯社来宣扬反孤立主义。

sentence.Network_en: The US constitution ample evidence of the founding fathers isolationist orientation.
sentence.Network_cn: 若仔细分析美国宪法,您就会发现美国国父的孤立主义倾向.

entry.tran: 孤立主义(指避免与别国关系过密或在别国之间的冲突中持中立态度)
entry.def: If you refer to isolationism, you are referring to a country's policy of avoiding close relationships with other countries and of not taking sides in disputes between other countries.

means.word_mean: 1. an advocate of isolationism in international affairs
